Text.Value: So, this toymaker's been converting cuddly bears into deadly traps? How wicked.
The owner of this place, the toymaker. He's packing explosive's into children's playthings.
The guy who owns this house was tampering with toys meant for the refugees!
The owner crafted those explosive toys - no doubt about it.
Look, Boo - this place is the source of those booby-trapped bears.
This toymaker's been turning children's playthings into bombs.
Hells - looks the proprietor concocted those lethal bears.
Explosives. This toymaker must be intent on shedding children's blood.
Whatever wretch lives in this place - they've been setting traps in toys meant for the refugees.
Explosives hidden inside toys... murder disguised as innocence. Very cunning.
Seems the owner of this place is responsible for those explosive stuffed bears in the barn.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: "The owner of this house... the toymaker... He was the one trapping the toys meant for the refugees!"

Text.Value: This is where the toys from the barn were crafted. What a wicked little workshop.
The toys from the barn - this must be where they were crafted.
Hey, we found these toys in the barn, right? Guess they were made here.
Look at this place. The evidence is clear enough.
This foul scene confirms it. Let us see how this toymaker likes having his stuffing spilled.
The toys from the barn - he must have made them here.
Just look at this place. The evidence speaks for itself.
The toys from the barn - this is where he crafted those murderous little things.
This is where the ones in the barn came from.
They are just like the ones we found in the barn.
This must be where he was making them - there's no shortage of evidence.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: (copy of the N3 node) | The toys we found in the barn!.. This is where he has been making them. |

Text.Value: This is where the toys from the barn were crafted. What a wicked little workshop.
The toys from the barn - this must be where they were crafted.
The toys from the barn! This fuck was the one making them.
Look at this place. The evidence is clear enough.
This foul scene confirms it. Let us see how this toymaker likes having his stuffing spilled.
The toys from the barn - he must have made them here.
Just look at this place. The evidence speaks for itself.
The toys from the barn - this is where he crafted those murderous little things.
This is where the toys in the barn were fashioned.
This is his workshop. Quite an ingenious setup.
This must be where he was making them - there's no shortage of evidence.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: | The toys we found in the barn!.. This is where he has been making them. |

Text.Value: I wonder where else these 'toys' have ended up. Who do you target with exploding bears?
Whoever lives here has dangerous hobbies. These toys can't ever reach childrens' hands.
Whoever lives here was up to something nasty. We ought to chek some of his 'donations'.
The homowner's playing some dangerous games. These are no ordinary toys he's making.
These are no fixings for a soft and cuddlesome toy. The children in these parts have strange tastes, Boo...
There's something distinctly unsafe about these. Better kept out of little hands.
This isn't right. Time to find the owner of this home and put his feet to the fire.
Something is amiss here. The owner of this place should be held to account for these - and any others should be found.
Whoever owns this place is up to something with these toys - we ought to find them.
These toys are not as innocent as they appear. Quite deadly, in fact. I wonder who made them?
Looks as though the homeowner's up to no good - I only hope no one gets hurt.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: "Owner of this house is messing with something dangerous. These toys should be found and checked." We don't know the toys has explosives in them yet. There's no explosives in the basement as well.
EditorData.logicalname: Don't know Arfur, didn't find toys

Text.Value: So, dear Arfur's been converting toys into deadly traps? Very naughty...
Planting explosives in toys? Is Arfur intent on maiming children?
Arfur, Arfur, Arfur. He was tampering with toys meant for the refugees!
Chk - Arfur's the one making those damnable toys.
Look, Boo - Arfur is the one putting booby-trapped bears into innocent baby hands.
Planting explosives in children's toys? That's low, Arfu.
By the gods - Arfur was the one who built those explosive bears.
That vile craven Arfu is planting explosives in toys meant for refugee children.
Arfur is a worse wretch than even we thought. He's been setting traps in toys meant for the refugees.
Arfur was responsible for the explosive toys. A cowardly way to cull the refugees.
It looks like our merchant friend's the one who's been putting explosives in teddy bears.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: "Oh no, our friend Arfur is even worse than we thought. He was the one trapping the toys meant for the refugees!". We already found the trapped toys in the Big Barn. Now we learn he was the one making and donating them.

Text.Value: Hardly the home of a sweet, generous soul. It might be worth looking into his 'donations' - who knows what he's been giving?
Arfur's got some curious hobbies. Better see if he donated any toys lately...
Our friend Arfur was up to something nasty. We ought to chek some of his 'donations'.
Arfur's playing a dangerous game. Time to check in on those so-called 'donations'.
These are not the fixings of a soft and cuddlesome toy. We should see what Arfur is really making...
Well this isn't suspicious at all. I hope Arfu's hasn't been donating cuddly toys to the needy...
Arfur's hardly the philanthropist he pretends to be. Those toys should be destroyed.
This bear totem is highly suspect. Arfu had better not be putting them into the wrong hands.
This is no innocent tinkering. What is Arfur up to down here?
These bears are perfect little assassins, disguised as innocent toys. It would be a pity if any found their way into children's hands.
Might be worth checking Arfur's donations - looks like his generosity's compromised.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: "Looks like our friend Arfur is messing with something dangerous. We should check the donations he's made." We don't know the toys has explosives in them yet. There's no explosives in the basement as well.

Synopsis: The party comments on finding a blackmail letter from Gortash to Arfur - the toymaker - forcing him to get some stuff out of the Fireworks Shop and put this into the toys to donate for the refugees. It's unclear what it is, but something that is not good.
